abstract: A Connecticut private equity firm, headed by a racing car fan, has agreed to buy Spyker Cars for about $44.5 million.
snippet: A Connecticut private equity firm, headed by a racing car fan, has agreed to buy Spyker Cars for about $44.5 million.
lead_paragraph: The Swedish company that owns Saab agreed on Thursday to sell its Spyker Cars unit, a maker of ultra-high-end sports cars, to the American private equity firm North Street Capital for €32 million, or $43.5 million.

headline.main: North Street Capital Buys Spyker for $43.5 Million

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
